chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent (2nd+ offense)

result.execSummary:
The defendant John T. Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent (2nd+ offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:31 PM Defendant John T. Martin appeared by video, in custody from JCI.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for John T. Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - there is an agreement
Court - speaks to deft's right to personal appearance
Deft - waives personal appearance
Court - accepts waiver
State - deft will enter plea to Cts 2, 4, & 6 (DRI Cts 1, 3, 5, 7) - joint rec of 6 years prison sentence (3 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES) concurrent to EC Case 22CF356, credit for 199 days
   Conditions: No contact with DDD (6/30/34) or CMW (3/10/62), Follow all recs of agent, eligible for CIP and SAP, court costs
Atty Lundeen - that is the agreement, deft needs to waive prelim
Court - speaks to deft's right to preliminary hearing
Deft - waives preliminary hearing
Court - accepts waiver, finds probable cause, and binds deft over for trial

Court - reads charges and max penalties
Deft - enters a guilty plea to Ct 2, enters a guilty plea to Ct 4, enters a guilty plea to Ct 6, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts guilty pleas to Cts 2, 4, & 6 and finds defendant guilty 

State - asks Court to follow joint agreement
Atty Lundeen - also asks Court to follow joint agreement
Deft - makes statement to the Court

Court orders - 
Count 2 - sentences to the deft to the Wisconsin Prison System for 6 years with 3 years IC and 3 years ES - concurrent to Eau Claire County case 22CF356 and Counts 4 & 6
  - Pay court costs of $538 + $10 drug abuse surcharge
  - Extended supervision conditions:
      - No contact with DDD 6/30/34
      - No contact with CMW 3/10/62
      - Follow all recommendations of agent
      - Eligible for any programs DOC finds deft eligible for
      - Credit for 199 days 

Count 4 - sentences to the deft to the Wisconsin Prison System for 6 years with 3 years IC and 3 years ES - concurrent to Eau Claire County case 22CF356 and Counts 2 & 6
  - Pay court costs of $538 + $10 drug abuse surcharge
  - Extended supervision conditions:
      - No contact with DDD 6/30/34
      - No contact with CMW 3/10/62
      - Follow all recommendations of agent
      - Eligible for any programs DOC finds deft eligible for

Count 6 - sentences to the deft to the Wisconsin Prison System for 6 years with 3 years IC and 3 years ES - concurrent to Eau Claire County case 22CF356 and Counts 2 & 4
  - Pay court costs of $538 + $10 drug abuse surcharge
  - Extended supervision conditions:
      - No contact with DDD 6/30/34
      - No contact with CMW 3/10/62
      - Follow all recommendations of agent
      - Eligible for any programs DOC finds deft eligible for

Dismissed and read-in: Counts 1, 3, 5, and 7
